column4: Hey is openoffice MEANT to install in the minimal system config regardless of not having X installed?
And why the heck is openoffice installed by default in the ubuntu-desktop metapackage anyways? And does anyone know a way to keep it from being reinstalled during distribution upgrades?
I find that annoying as well
Turned out it's *500* megs. ~1/4 of the 9.10 default install. Minimal now without that is ~510 megs, with an incomplete copy of gnome is 1 gig o.O
